entry.title: Re: Request for Actual Cost Report on Existing WBS Elements
entry.content:
Hello @SudeCeper 

Try reviewing these references for more detail.

Analytical Apps for Plan/Actual Analysis,  Project Progress Reporting,  Commercial View ,  Project History PS PUBLIC CLOUD

Custom Analytical Queries

To summarise, the classic on-premise report is not available in public cloud. This is because traditional GUI transaction codes have been replaced with the Fiori apps and CDS-based analytical reports.

In public cloud you can do the following in regards to your use case:

  • Generate project actuals and financial reports through the Project actuals Fiori app.
  • You can display the commercial view of your project reports, measuring your plan vs. actuals using the app.
  • You can display actual line items by drilling down to individual postings at WBS level.
  • You can generate aggregated and detailed project cost report at WBS level.
  • Finally, you can create your own custom analytical query on top of released CDS views.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: error with webservice Procedure in SQL Anywhere
entry.content:
Hm, the log of the requests misses the body of the HTTP POST, methinks. (Not that I do think this would matter.)
Only one of your POST requests ends the URL with '/', does that make a difference?

Otherwise, I have no clue about the issue - I have only ever got the -990 SQLCODE when the certificate was not valid (or the web server used another certificate as I expected...). Of course you could add a CERTIFICATE clause and provide details like sni_hostname if required. But a certificate error would usually affect all HTTP methods and should prevent the server from applying the request at all.

So just a ‚Äì probably unhelpful ‚Äì suggestion: You might add the EXCEPTIONS=OFF option (say, via "set 'HTTP(EXCEPTIONS=OFF; VERSION=1.1)'") to your web service procedures as a test. It is usually only required to get the response of HTTP error codes (4xx, 5xx), which do not apply here (as you get a 204) - but maybe this could reveal more information.

entry.title: Re: SAP Adobe form - User unable to copy text
entry.content:
Hi @manohar_penuballi60 ,

How to fix (no OCR needed):

  1. Generate the PDF directly from Adobe Document Services (ADS) (server-side). Don‚Äôt ‚ÄúPrint to PDF‚Äù or use LOCL/SAPWIN‚Äîthose turn pages into images.

  2. In the form, use real text fields, not images that already contain text (logos/letterheads are fine, but the content must be text objects).

  3. Make sure fonts are embedded on the ADS side.

  4. Check PDF security: allow content copying.

Do those and the output will be a normal, selectable PDF.

Regards,
Sudheer Chunduru

entry.title: Re: How to upload an Excel file to backend and display da...
entry.content:
Hi @s_sudhirkumar ,

You can build this quickly in SAP Build Apps without iFlows by accepting CSV (Excel ‚ûú Save As ‚ûú .csv). Then, parse and upload all in the app.

Steps

  1. UI

    • Add a File Picker (accept: .csv).

    • Add a Table/Data Grid bound to a page variable, e.g. pageVars.rows.

  2. Parse & preview (File Picker ‚Üí Files selected)

    • Flow: Open file ‚Üí Base64 to text ‚Üí Parse CSV (tick ‚Äúheader row‚Äù).

    • Set the output list to pageVars.rows.

    • The table will show the data immediately.

  3. Upload to backend

    • Create a Data resource (OData/REST) via a BTP Destination.

    • If your API supports bulk: HTTP Request (POST) with pageVars.rows.

    • If not: Repeat with pageVars.rows ‚Üí Create record for each item (optional chunking of ~200 rows + small Delay to avoid timeouts).

  4. Validation & UX

    • Check required headers before upload; map/rename columns if needed.

    • Convert types (NUMBER/DATE) during the loop before calling Create.

    • Show a small progress indicator: uploaded / total.

If you later need native .xlsx, move parsing to a tiny backend (CAP/Function) and keep the same UI.

Regards,
Sudheer Chunduru

entry.title: Re: Cost price difference (PRD) in transaction MIGO for V...
entry.content:
For the error you shared ‚ÄúAccount determination for entry OPWE PRD 0001 ___ 3061 not possible‚Äù, it means SAP is trying to post a price difference to account 3061 (or whatever is configured for transaction key PRD), but it can‚Äôt find a valid G/L account in OBYC for the combination of:

  • Transaction key: PRD (Price Difference)
  • Valuation class
  • Chart of accounts
  • Valuation area (plant)

To answer your question "Why SAP post price differences for MAP?"  SAP posts price differences during GR for MAP materials only if:

  • Invoice price is known at GR time (e.g., via PO condition or info record)
  • GR price ‚â† PO price (e.g., PO says ‚Çπ100, but GR is posted at ‚Çπ120)
  • MAP is not allowed to adjust due to config or timing issues
  • GR is posted in a future period (e.g., 08/2025) and the system cannot update MAP retroactively or the posting logic triggers a price difference due to valuation timing

So go to OBYC, and ensure Transaction key PRD is maintained for your valuation class and plant. This will resolve the error even if SAP insists on posting a price difference

entry.title: Re: Can I extend a certain app? With Clean Core? How?
entry.content:
Hi @AlessandroSpadoni 

Late reply but better late than never. If you cannot analyze a Fiori app but you have web dynpro, transaction code, or maybe even an old-school query. Then you have to start from the business context. What is your "app" about? What's the data, the main object? You can search business object interfaces also on hub.sap.com/api.sap.com. This will give you interface CDS view entities. Knowing the context, you can see if you are able to extend the context in Custom Fields. If not, use the interface CDS and from there you can figure out other CDS involved with your context, and lastly check if they are released with C0 contract. Then proceed to extend as you need. Hope that helps.

Regards

entry.title: Re: Migration Cockpit: Exclude data from sub structures
entry.content:
Hello Victor,

did you adapt the selection criteria scope in LTMOM? (see screenshot)

The default setting is "Parent and child tables" and means that the selection affects the parent tables. If you left this setting, that could be the cause, why the customers were excluded completely. 

When using the BAdI, the selection criteria scope has the following effect. Only the instances considered relevant in KNB5 are also considered relevant for the parent tables, if you choose "parent and child tables". If you set the selection criteria scope to "Child tables only", then the result set from KNB5 does not propagate upwards.

Please also check 3249988 - Details on selection process - SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit - Direct Transfer - SAP for Me. You will find two documents, which describe the selection process in detail.

With the SKIP rule your requirement cannot be achieved. The SKIP rule exclusively determines "relevant YES/NO" for the entire (!) instance.

I hope this helps to solve your requirement.

Best regards, Kirstin

entry.title: Re: Planning ERP to S4H FINS_ACDOC_PLANNING100 Message
entry.content:
When checked in se91 for FINS_ACDOC_PLANNING100, it shows "&1 &2 &3 &4". This means it‚Äôs a generic placeholder message. The actual text is supposed to be filled dynamically at runtime by the program/report (R_FINS_PLANTRANS_CO_ERP_2_S4H). If nothing is passed to those placeholders, you just see the raw &1 &2 &3 &4. So in your case, the report is raising message FINS_ACDOC_PLANNING100, but it isn‚Äôt passing any values into the placeholders. That‚Äôs why you don‚Äôt see a meaningful explanation.

What you can do is run the report again and then check transaction SLG1 with object FINS_ACDOC_PLANNING. Often the detailed log is written there, even if the message text is empty.

Look in table ACDOCP for your controlling area, version, fiscal year. If no records exist, the message may simply mean ‚Äúno data selected‚Äù or ‚Äúno data transferred.‚Äù

entry.title: Re: SAP Digital Manufacturing (DMC) ‚Äì QA Environment Setup with a Single SAP Cloud Platform Integrat
entry.content:
Thanks @KatjaHuschle  for this interesting blog that helped us set up SAP DM with multi-backend connectivity in our landscape.

We came across one point that is a severe limitation currently, though: The DM-EWM interfaces delivered with DM CPI standard content are not properly multi-backend enabled as described above. It is not possible to dynamically determine S/4 backend connectivity parameters, so that multi-backend connectivity for EWM interfaces only works if and when:

  • S/4 backends are behind the same Cloud Connector
  • S/4 backends share the same client
  • S/4 backend authentication happens through same RFC user ID and password for all backends.

As S/4 embedded EWM is the default warehousing setup for S/4 going foward, this is an important limitation which I want to mention here in the comments. For those interested in a resolution, please support our Improvement Request for the issue. Thanks!

entry.title: Re: How to authorize a CF-deployed HTML5 app via a Conten...
entry.content:
Hi @theodore_abitbol ,

another approach you could go with, is to leverage the CDM exposure via the HTML5 Repository, which is possible in the meantime. This capability allows to add CDM definitions, like roles, spaces & pages to the deployment of your HTML5 app to the HTML5 Repository of BTP. Then, instead of consuming the app directly via the "HTML5 Apps" Content Channel, you can create a dedicated Channel (either a manual "Content Provider" or the newly introduced "HTML5 Business Solution"). With this, not only your HTML5 App is being exposed to SAP Build Work Zone, but also the CDM you included into the deployment.

You can check out the following Blog Post which describes this approach (although its focus is mainly the cross-subaccount consumption): https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/simplifying-html5-content-consumption-across-subaccounts/ba-p/13758568

Hope this helps.

entry.title: Re: About use API to create partial billing document base...
entry.content:
Yes this is a current product limitation of the public cloud APIs. The API does not support interactive item selection or quantity adjustment like the Fiori app. SAP‚Äôs official guidance is to handle the splitting logic outside SAP (in middleware or custom logic) and then call the API with the desired quantities.

What that means is if you want to bill partial quantities via API, in your middleware or calling system, decide how much of each delivery item should be billed. Construct the API payload with those quantities (instead of the full delivery quantity). Call the API once for each partial billing you want to create. If you want to split one delivery into multiple billing documents (like you can in the app), you must make multiple API calls, each with a subset of items/quantities.

SAP‚Äôs documentation on Billing Document Split and Convergence explains that the system can split billing documents based on split‚Äërelevant fields and user settings in the Create Billing Documents app and this section makes clear that the interactive split/merge logic is part of the app, not the API.

entry.title: Re: Notifications from SAP Build Apps to Work Zone
entry.content:
@kazistov_v From a security point of view, it would discouraged to do it with the approach that you are attempting. Why? The logic you are implementing in SAP Build Apps is executed on the front-end. This means, with your approach you are effectively allowing each and every authenticated user to trigger notifications to any arbitrary receiver of your tenant.

The credentials for the notification service (e.g. via a BTP destination), should not be exposed as a dynamic destination to front-end clients (like your Build Apps application deployed to the HTML5 Repository & SAP Build Work Zone). Instead, the logic for creating notifications and interacting with the notification API should only be done from a "backend" application you deploy to SAP BTP to stay in control of which notifications are sent to which user. Unfortunately this would rather fall under the "pro-code" category. One fairly easy approach would be to leverage CAP (SAP Cloud Application Programming Model), which has a plugin that simplifies sending notifications: https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/plugins/#notifications

entry.title: Re: Hi Team,
entry.content:
Please note after Release or Partial Confirmation, direct change of cost center is not possible in standard. Some options are

  • Technical completion (TECO) or close the existing orders, then create new orders with the correct cost center.
  • Use manual reposting of costs in Controlling with transactions like KB11N, KB21N, to move already posted costs from the ‚Äúwrong‚Äù cost center to the ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù one.
  • For future confirmations, you could change the work center master data (CR02) to point to the new cost center, but this only affects new orders created afterwards, not existing ones.

entry.title: Process Order Not Inheriting GI Storage Location from Production Version (PP-PI) S/4HANA
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am working on SAP S/4HANA (on-premise) in a PP-PI (Process Industries) environment and facing an issue where my process order does not inherit the Goods Issue (GI) storage location for components from the Production Version in the Material List tab.

My setup:

  • In the Production Version, I have maintained both the GR and GI storage locations.

  • When I create a process order using this Production Version:

    • The GR storage location (receiving location) is correctly inherited into the order.

    • The GI storage location for components remains blank and is not inherited.

Additional information:

  • All components are extended to the relevant storage locations.

  • In the BOM, the storage location field is left blank at the component level.

  • In the Material Master (MRP 2 tab), the Issue Storage Location field is also blank.

  • My materials are not assigned to any MRP group 

Business context:

I have two production lines, each represented by a different storage location.

  • Some finished goods can be produced on either line.

  • Initially, I solved this by creating alternative BOMs (one per production line).

  • However, this approach creates unnecessary complexity in master data, as I want to maintain only one BOM per material per plant for engineering purposes and instead control the GI/GR storage location through the Production Version.

What I have checked so far:

  • I read on other SAP forum threads that this behavior could be related to MRP group customizing (transaction OPPQ ‚Üí Storage location determination).

  • In my system (transaction OPPR), the "Storage location determination" button appears only under Repetitive Manufacturing (REM).

  • Since we are in a PP-PI process, and my materials are not linked to any MRP group, I am unsure whether this configuration is relevant or applicable to my case.

Question:

Is there a way in S/4HANA on-premise to make the process order automatically inherit the GI storage location for components directly from the Production Version, just like it already does for the GR storage location?
Or is there some additional customizing step (e.g., MRP groups or another configuration) required to enable this behavior?

Thank you in advance for your guidance!

#S4/HANA #ONPREMISE #ProductionPlanning #ProcessIndustries

entry.title: Re: Support for Base64-Encoded Fingerprints in SFTP Adapter
entry.content:
Hi,

After update our PO system 7.50 to stack SP33, we started to get error related to fingerprints...

After doing some tests we set the channel fingerprint in Base64 in that way: SHA256:xxxxxx.... without set in section advanced mode the new parameter useBase64Fingerprint.

So we think that the default value for this parameter is true, at least in 7.50 stack SP33.

Best regards.

entry.title: Re: Removeall SAP MDG (MDG_FND , MDG_APPL and other MDG components
entry.content:
Hi Marc, 

In MDG-Implementation, Most MDG business functions are non-reversible. Once activated, they

generally cannot be deactivated without restoring the system from a backup, which is often

impractical. Therefore, it's crucial to be certain about which functions are required for the

implementation scope before activation.

 

Regards.

entry.title: Re: PM Order User Status Reset Once CNF Done.
entry.content:
With the standard functionality, system statuses like CRTD, REL, PCNF, CNF, TECO are set automatically by SAP when you perform business transactions like release, confirmation, or technical completion. User statuses are additive and they don‚Äôt get reset by confirmations unless you‚Äôve configured them to do so (e.g. ‚Äúset/deactivate with business transaction‚Äù in the profile). So if your user status is disappearing, it suggests either Custom logic is interfering (user exit, BAdI, enhancement) or data inconsistency in the order status tables (TJ20, JEST).

So what you can do is

  • Run RIORDST1 in test mode to see if your affected orders are flagged as inconsistent. Check SAP Note 67826. This note delivers the standard report RIORDST1, which checks and repairs inconsistencies between system status and user status in PM/CS orders. It‚Äôs often the first diagnostic step when you see statuses disappearing or being reset.
  • Review your status profile customizing (SPRO ‚Üí PM/CS ‚Üí Maintenance and Service Orders ‚Üí General Data ‚Üí User Status for Orders) to confirm no ‚Äúset/deactivate with business transaction‚Äù rules are unintentionally wiping statuses.
  • If none of the above resolves it, raise an OSS incident with SAP Support, referencing the notes above and attaching examples of orders where the reset occurs.

entry.title: Re: EWM Pinter assignment to packaging material
entry.content:
I am not sure if you mean Print on the Printer (not to have access, because it sounds like authorization topic). So if it is about printer determination for User1 HU with PM 1 should be printed on LP01, User2 + PM1 = LP02, and PM2 should be always printed on the LP03, it could be solved with condition technique but in different ways. If I assume so like you described it, User + PM you can maintain in the condition for PM2 with LP03, and for PM1 without printer, in this case default printer from user record should be taken. If it is not flexible enough, you can use logical Conditions (LCxx), where you maintain for LC01 User1 (or group of users1) and second logical condition with user2 (LC02), and you create 3 records 

  1. PM1 + LC01 = LP01
  2. PM1 + LC02 = LP02
  3. PM2 = LP03 (without logical condition)

entry.title: Re: Cannot access script variable in calculation editor f...
entry.content: It seems your script has syntex errors. In SAC scripting, never type full IDs manually. Instead, place the cursor where x is and type the first letter of the measure or dimension ( for script variable type @ as shown in snapshot. In my snapshot "Filter_var" is script variable) , The editor will show suggestions; pick the right one from the list. This way, the correct ID is inserted automatically and syntax errors are avoided. Write like this: IF(x , , ), ,)  (1)At the place of x, type the first letter of the measure or dimension. (2) The system will show suggestions, then you can pick the correct one. (3) This avoids wrong IDs and syntax errors.

entry.title: Re: Process Order Not Inheriting GI Storage Location from...
entry.content:
For information, the standard SAP logic for GI storage location determination is for components in production/process orders, SAP does not read the GI storage location from the production version. Instead, the system follows a fixed priority sequence:

  • If a storage location is maintained at BOM item level (STPO-LGORT), this is transferred into the order.
  • If no storage location is in the BOM, the system checks the issue storage location (MARC-LGPRO) in the material master.
  • If the component is assigned to an operation, and the work center has a supply area with a storage location, this can override the above.
  • The GI storage location remains blank in the order component list. I believe, this is what you are seeing.
  • Also, please note Production Version in standard only controls GR storage location (header level, for the finished product), BOM/routing selection and Lot size validity. It does not control the GI storage location of components.

So in order to achieve your requirement,

  • Maintain Issue Storage Location in Material Master (MRP 2 tab). Simple, but only one storage location per plant/material. Doesn‚Äôt solve your ‚Äútwo lines, two storage locations‚Äù case.
  • Assign supply areas to work centers, each with its own storage location. When you assign components to operations, the system can derive the correct GI storage location from the supply area.

entry.title: Re: Structured address data elements in ISO 20022 messages
entry.content:
Hello,
Thanks for the detailed blog post. I would like to raise a question because there seems to be a discrepancy between the dates mentioned here and the official EPC guidance document that is linked in the post (EPC Guideline document).

The EPC document ( page 4/18 clearly states the following timeline for address usage under ISO20022):

 

Period Allowed formatsNot allowed
Until 05 Oct 2025Structured, UnstructuredHybrid
05 Oct 2025 ‚Äì 22 Nov 2026Structured, Hybrid, Unstructured‚Äì
From 22 Nov 2026 onwardsStructured, HybridUnstructured

This means that Unstructured addresses are not phased out in November 2025, but only in November 2026. Also, the Hybrid model remains valid beyond 2026 (no end date defined).

Could you please clarify why the blog mentions November 2025 as the end date for unstructured addresses, while the official EPC guidance extends it until November 2026?

Thanks in advance for your clarification.

entry.title: Re: SAP B1 Cloud Can't Assign Extensions
entry.content:
Dear Boonthep,

Please go to the presentation server, go windows services manager, and check the "SAP Business One Client Agent" is correctly configured and started. See SAP Note 1764311 for your reference.

After that please restart SAP Business One Client Agent services on all Presentation servers assigned to corresponding service unit (S90) and try to deploy Extension again.
 After deploying an extension to a service unit, you can assign the extension to tenants.
 
For more information please follow chapters from Administrator's Guide - SAP Business One Cloud:
 
9.4 Deploying Extensions
9.5 Assigning Extensions
 
I hope this helps.
 
Kind regards,
Ladislav
SAP Support

entry.title: Calling bound RAP action from CAP / Node.js backend with OData V4
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am trying to call a bound RAP Action from a CAP backend and am running into some issues with the namespace that comes with the service beeing OData V4. 

As described in the CAP documentation I tried the following syntax:

let response = await external_service.send({
   event: 'final_approval',
   entity: '<MyEntity>',
   data: { 
      username: req.user.id.toLowerCase(), 
      reason: '' },
   params: [{
      ID: id
   }]
})

 This returns an error because the ressource can't be found. As to be expected, because OData V4 action calls need the namespace added as a prefix. The rest of the call looks totally fine.

If I adapt the code to include the namespace, it looks like this:

let response = await external_service.send({
   event: '<MyNamespace>.final_approval',
   entity: '<MyEntity>',
   data: { 
      username: req.user.id.toLowerCase(), 
      reason: '' },
   params: [{
      ID: id
   }]
})

The request fails again - with error:  URI has a slash as last character
This is the result from the the call URI not beeing build correctly. It looks something like this:

/sap/opu/odata4/.../<MyEntity/

The ID is not passed to the URI anymore, so the intance is not called, as well as the actual action call that is missing completely.

Did anyone experience the same behavior?

Note: I got it to work by building the request myself:

let response = await external_service.send({
   method: 'POST',
   headers: {
      "If-Match": '*'
   },
   path: `/<MyEntity>(${id})/<MyNamespace>.final_approval`,
   data: { 
       username: req.user.id.toLowerCase(), 
       reason: ''
   },
})

Thanks in advance!
Best regards,
Lukas

entry.title: Re: Supplier specific number range for ERS invoices
entry.content:
Hello Raf,

coming late on this topic : the flow ERS Vendor Invoice Numbering as described by notes 684514 & 571376  +  blog :https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/key-customization-to-enable-vendor-specific-number-range-in-self-billing/ba-p/13247335
works on S4H with BP "instead" of Vendors as well.

The key point is to be able to maintain the field "LFA1-STCD4" with theVendor new numbering group  code defined in number range J_1AOFFDOC ¬´ Official Documents ¬ª.
To do this, you need to maintain Tax NB 4 in BP - FI supplier role "FLVN00" - for tab Indentification.

For example for a vendor in France : that would be Category Tax "FR4" which will lead to field LFA1-STCD4.
If the Tax Catefory is not present for your country : you are missing BP customizing : please see link https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/74b0b157c81944ffaac6ebc07245b9dc/05a5afc94d844866be6a8a273b6d35f0.html

 

Hope this helps.

Stephane

entry.title: Re: MIGO ITEM ADD NEW FIELD
entry.content: You cannot directly add a field to MIGO item tabs. So what you can do is use BAdI MB_MIGO_BADI to create a custom subscreen at item level. You can choose an existing tab (General/Where/Quantity) or create a new tab. Handle data persistence via append structures or Z-tables.
